page.title: 05Natural History, The Lee p.1
page.content: The block is high ground on the escarpment of the Chiltern Hills, consisting mainly of chalk sub-soil with clay and flints. {Reserves}The Bucks, Berks & Oxon Naturalists Trust (BBONT) has one in the block with a resident warden. Care is undertaken in the reserve woodland. A boundary hedge was laid in the traditional way some time ago & now shows the benefit of this treatment. {Flora}Typical Chiltern beechwoods & chalk flora eg bluebells, helleborines & orchids eg Common Spotted, Early Purple, Twayblades, Pyramidal, Bee, Fragrant & Bird's Nest. In clearings, primroses, cowslips, Chiltern Gentians & wood anenomes regenerate. Hedgerows are mainly hawthorn, elder, honeysuckle, wild rose & bramble. {Fungi}Bracket fungi & fly agaric are common in the beechwoods.
